wikipedia_page.main: Maurice Arthur Ponsonby Wood,  (26 August 1916 – 24 June 2007) was an Anglican bishop in the Evangelical tradition. He was a Royal Navy commando chaplain in World War II and later the Bishop of Norwich.

response: * Maurice Wood – Bishop of Norwich, recorded the gospel in Norfolk dialect
* 1947–1952: Maurice Wood, later Principal of Oak Hill College and Bishop of Norwich
* 1961–1971: Maurice Wood, later Bishop of Norwich
* The Right Revd Maurice Wood DSC, 1916-2007, Principal of Oak Hill Theological College and Bishop of Norwich
*Maurice Wood, 90, British Anglican Bishop of Norwich (1971–1985).
